definition.description: The location/region where the virtual network resides.
Name of the resource group in which to deploy your new Virtual Machines
The name of the resource group in which your existing storage account with your existing VHD resides
The name of the storage account in which your existing VHD and image reside
The Tier of the storage account in which your existing VHD and image reside (Standard or Premium)
The Replication Type of the storage account in which your existing VHD and image reside (Options include LRS and GRS)
This variable is used in this template to create various other names, such as vnet name, subnet name, storage account name, et. al.
Defines the type of storage account to be created. Valid options are Standard or Premium.
Defines the Replication Type for the storage account to be created. Valid options include LRS, ZRS, GRS and RAGRS.
The address prefix to use for the subnet.
Name of the VHD to be used as source syspreped/generalized image to deploy the VM, for example 'mybaseimage.vhd'
Name of the new VM deployed from the custom image. Must be 3-15 characters.
Local administrator password, complex password is required, do not use any variation of the word 'password' because it will be rejected. Minimum 8 characters.
Name of the local administrator account, this cannot be 'Admin', 'Administrator', or 'root'.
Type of OS on the existing vhd. Allowed values: 'windows' or 'linux'.
Full URIs for one or more custom images (VHDs) that should be copied to the deployment storage account to spin up new VMs from them. URLs must be comma separated.

Name of the Windows VM that will perform the copy of the VHD from a source storage account to the new storage account created in the new deployment, this is known as transfer vm. Must be 3-15 characters.
VM size of new virtual machine that will be deployed from a custom image.
The address space that is used by the virtual network. You can supply more than one address space. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
the name of the offer (az vm image list)
name of the publisher of the image (az vm image list)
image sku to apply (az vm image list)
version of the image to apply (az vm image list)
